results.title: The Song of Bernadette cinema slide
results.brief_description: Glass Cinema lantern slide with black edging tape. This hand coloured slide is an advertisement for the film ‘The Song of Bernadette’ featuring Jennifer Jones and Charles Bickford produced by Twentieth Century Fox Picture. Three pieces of cream tape have been adhered to the top and bottom edges to cover cinema session details.

results.title: Under the Clock cinema slide
results.brief_description: Glass Cinema lantern slide with black edging tape and internal black frame. This hand coloured slide is an advertisement for the film ‘Under the Clock’ featuring Judy Garland by Metro Goldwyn Mayer Ltd. A piece of light brown tape has been adhered to the top edge of the image to cover session times.

results.title: Strange Cities
results.credit_line:
Creator: Tatiana Pentes
Original musical score: Serge Ermoll (Sergei Emolaeff) and Alexander Vertinsky
Co-development & Cinematography: Geoffrey James Weary
Producer: Eurydice Aroney
Sound Design: Roi Huberman
Interface Design and Programming: Glenn Remington
results.brief_description: ‘Strange Cities’ is an experimental interactive multimedia work that tells of the survival of the Russian and Chinese Communist Revolutions by two Russian exiles. It draws upon the legacy of the Shanghai milieu, the Chinese gangster film, a musical cabaret genre, orientalist erotic literature, intrigue novels, and the films of Josef von Sternberg to explore memory, transience and the urban imagination. It is an experimental interactive multimedia work authored for CD-Rom release and exhibition. Through the disclosure of evidence, Sasha dreams, discovers, remembers the exilic identity of her grandparents Xenia and Sergei Ermolaeff (a composer and orchestra leader) in fragments and traces of their music, memories, personal effects and photographs, in their struggle to survive the Russian and Chinese Communist Revolutions. The inspiration for the work is a tune of the same name - a musical illustration, an imaginary vision of old Shanghai, Chinese metropolis, and International Settlement, conjuring mythic, filmic, musical and personal images of the city port. The ‘Strange cities’ musical score1 written by Alexander Vertinsky, Serge Ermoll and Ira Bloch, was first performed by a jazz orchestra of White Russian emigres in the cabarets of the International Settlement of Shanghai, China in the 1930’s and 40’s. ‘Strange cities’ draws upon the legacy of the Shanghai milieu, the Chinese gangster film, a musical cabaret genre, orientalist erotic literature, intrigue novels, and the films of Josef von Sternberg. Coined capital of the international underworld, the city of Shanghai became a seductively strange locale symbolized in the Western imagination, in reality the city was most often the final port of call for political refugees.

results.title: Sept Visions Fugitives
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Sept Visions Fugitives was produced in China. Cahen creates impressionistic transformations of landscape and people. He writes: “The looking and listening audiences are confronted — in addition to the pure impressions — with basic questions about work (the boy using a traditional device to shake the feathers from the mattress) about freedom, about life in China … and ultimately about life and death: the burial, the bird, the man with a sheaf of straw on his back symbolizing the passage, the beyond ….. I had to struggle to make what I know are stereotyped images my own. The pure impressions and raw filmic material are completely reworked, going much further than the original takes.” Source: Electronic Arts Intermix [www.eai.org]

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Easter celebrations at Green Hill]
results.brief_description:
This film shows Greek Easter celebrations, including a community BBQ, cooking lamb on a spit, music and dancing.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: A Continent on guard
results.creator_credit: Bob Walker, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Presents a dramatic, simulated investigation into a suspected outbreak of foot and mouth disease in Australia, and points out what measures would be taken to eradicate the disease. Note: A complementary production to ‘The constant threat’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Walker, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
